snippet.title: Tetris 2 (Nintendo, 1993) - NES Gameplay
snippet.description:
Uses disconnected colored tetriminoes instead of adjacent type tetrominoes. It is the first Tetris to make use of the gravity algorithm. Blocks of the same color stick together. The goal of Tetris 2 is to clear the bottom rows, which a similar type of play can be found in the later released The Next Tetris or Tetris II. Released as Tetris Flash in Japan.

Known on Famicom as: Tetris Flash

NES Relatives:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvUK-YWYcaE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLTj9LTd-NA
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3wOFyKq1RY8


NESGUIDE ARCHIVE INFO

The original NES gameplay archive, est 2007 includes gameplay captures from all commercial releases from the US market with a few extras (like famicom releases) just for fun. As of Dec 2024, I've resumed efforts to update some of the older (some 360p) videos with higher-def captures. Text updates will be posted to BlueSky (which doesn't require an account to view). Please follow there (or just bookmark the url) if you're interested!

https://bsky.app/profile/nesguide.com
